text: I think competition is a good thing you
know I've got 11 of brothers and sisters
I learned about competition early on we
were kids we always regretted having a
big family but look back on now I don't
regret it so we're just a normal family
as normal as you can be with 12 people
the big family is an essential element
of Republican House Minority Leader John
Boehner spy ography I've got 11 brothers
and sisters my dad owned a bar if
Republicans win a majority in the US
House of Representatives next month mr.
Boehner will likely replace Nancy Pelosi
as Speaker of the House we traveled to
his hometown to get a sense of how
growing up here in redding Ohio may have
shaped him the 12 Boehner siblings were
raised in this house just north of
Cincinnati
while mr. Boehner has said that
Democrats have snuffed out the America
he grew up in his home town feels almost
frozen in time both in his traditions
and the way it looks all these houses
nothing has changed here john Whitmire
was a classmate and friend he remembers
days and nights filled with high school
football and hard work there was one
Saturday where mr. Boehner looked
exceptionally tired and it wasn't just
from friday night's game I said well did
you get a good night's sleep and he says
well not exactly i had to go down to the
bar and bring beer up from the basement
at i don't know like four or five
o'clock in the morning the family ran
andy's a neighborhood bar mr. boehner
sister Linda still works there we came
up in hospital we all came to Andy's
before we went home for the first time
another important influence was the
Catholic Church this is where both of us
got married in st. peter and paul jerry

football team mate even though they
graduated high school just a year before
Woodstock the social upheavals of the
1960's didn't seem to resonate I think
we went to church prolly every day there
for a while you'd start your day off
with mass
there just weren't as many issues then
there weren't gates you didn't know
anything about gays you didn't know
anything about abortion didn't know
anything about a lot of the social
issues they got today you know the
principles I grew up with are the
principles of the Republican Party even
though I grew up as a Democrat our
parents were probably all Democrats and
supported the heck out of Kennedy
because he was Catholic growing up with
Polly Kennedy Catholics Bob Boehner is
John's older brother his story of
becoming a republican is common here but
the first time you've got a real job and
you get your paycheck and look down you
what was the rest of your money and they
explained to you that's the tax you got
paid a government you start thinking
more and more about becoming the
Republican leader Boehner declined an
on-camera interview with The Times but
he did speak to us for the story he
remembers a slightly different moment of
political transformation you know Ronald
Reagan's the guy that I listen to him
watched and decided I think I think I'm
with him and so I guess you could call
me a Reagan Republican been through high
school there was no interest in politics
from what I saw mr. Boehner didn't
become politically active until later he
joined his homeowners association almost
on a lark when he moved to the more
affluent suburbs farther north his golf
game improved and he rose quickly in
politics or they work in Congress on

you know check you out mr. boehner

stuff that I can close my eyes in here
Foust giving that speech can you say it
was done openly with transparency and

and struck behind closed doors hidden
from the people hello you can't six
months ago mr. Boehner was unknown and
even large swaths of his own state but
he's become a national figure during the
midterm election Democrats think that by
making him the face of the Republican
Party it will rebound to their benefit
mr. Boehner has so far said no for all
his years as the ultimate Washington
insider mr. Boehner still resonates
among many constituents as the guy from
down the street I've had every rotten
job there was in America but thankful
that I had each of those jobs i walked
through airports I get our restaurants a
standout on a corner people have plenty
of access to me if he becomes Speaker of
the House this man from Moeller high
school would be second in the
presidential line of succession well get
